title: UR4MORE Discipleship Core (12 Weeks)
description: A practical 12-week journey to follow Jesus deeply and live on mission.

weeks.title: Identity in Christ
weeks.theme: Discovering who you are in Christ and your new identity as a child of God.
weeks.lessonSummary: You are a new creation in Christ, chosen and adopted by God. This week you can explore what it means to live from your true identity rather than trying to earn your worth. When you understand who you are in Jesus, you can face life from a place of security and confidence.
keyIdeas: You are a beloved child of God, not because of what you do, but because of who Jesus is
Your old self died with Christ; you now live as a new creation
You can fight from victory, not for victory - your worth is already secured in Christ
When you die to self, you make room for God's love to flow through you
reflectionQs: What does it mean to you that you're a child of God?
How might knowing your true identity change how you face challenges today?
What old identity patterns do you need to let go of?

practice.title: Daily Identity Read
practice.desc: Read your identity statements each morning; note one word that stands out.

practice.title: Gratitude Note
practice.desc: Write a 2-line gratitude to God for one way you saw grace today.

weeks.prayer: Father, help me to see myself as You see me - as Your beloved child, chosen and secure in Christ. May I live from this truth today.

weeks.title: The Gospel of Grace
weeks.theme: Understanding salvation through Jesus and the assurance of new life by grace.
weeks.lessonSummary: The gospel isn't just how you get saved - it's how you live every day. You can rest in God's grace, knowing that Jesus has done everything needed for your salvation. This week you can explore how grace transforms your relationship with God and others.
keyIdeas: Salvation is a free gift from God, not something you can earn
Grace means God loves you even when you don't deserve it
You can be confident in your salvation because it depends on Jesus, not you
Grace should overflow from you to others
reflectionQs: How does understanding grace change how you view your mistakes?
Where do you see grace at work in your life this week?
How can you extend grace to someone who has hurt you?

practice.title: Grace Journal
practice.desc: Each evening, write down one way you experienced God's grace today.

practice.title: Grace Conversation
practice.desc: Have one conversation where you choose grace over judgment.

weeks.prayer: Thank You, God, for Your amazing grace that saves me and sustains me. Help me to live in the freedom of Your love and extend that same grace to others.

weeks.title: The Word of God
weeks.theme: Building the habit of Bible reading and learning to apply Scripture in daily life.
weeks.lessonSummary: The Bible isn't just a book - it's God's living word that can transform your life. You can develop a simple, sustainable habit of reading Scripture that fits your life. This week you can learn how to hear from God through His word and apply what you read.
keyIdeas: Scripture is God's primary way of speaking to His people
You don't need to read huge amounts - consistency matters more than quantity
The Bible is meant to be applied, not just studied
God's word can guide your decisions and transform your thinking
reflectionQs: What's your current relationship with reading the Bible?
What time of day works best for you to connect with God through Scripture?
How can you apply one verse you've read this week?

practice.title: Daily Reading
practice.desc: Read one chapter or passage each day; ask 'What is God saying to me?'

practice.title: Scripture Memory
practice.desc: Choose one verse from this week to memorize and meditate on.

weeks.prayer: Lord, open my heart to hear Your voice through Your word. Help me to not just read Scripture, but to let it change me and guide my life.

weeks.title: Prayer and Devotion
weeks.theme: Growing in prayer, listening to God, and developing a daily relationship with Him.
weeks.lessonSummary: Prayer is simply talking with God - it doesn't need to be complicated or formal. You can develop a rhythm of prayer that feels natural and life-giving. This week you can explore different ways to pray and learn to listen for God's voice.
keyIdeas: Prayer is conversation with God, not a performance
You can pray anywhere, anytime, about anything
Listening is just as important as speaking in prayer
Prayer changes you even when circumstances don't change
reflectionQs: What does your current prayer life look like?
What would help you feel more comfortable talking with God?
How do you sense God speaking to you?

practice.title: Morning Prayer
practice.desc: Start each day with 5 minutes of honest conversation with God.

practice.title: Prayer Walk
practice.desc: Take a 10-minute walk and pray for people and situations as they come to mind.

weeks.prayer: Father, thank You that You want to hear from me. Help me to be honest and open in our conversations, and teach me to listen for Your voice.

weeks.title: The Holy Spirit
weeks.theme: Living by the Holy Spirit's power and understanding His guidance and gifts.
weeks.lessonSummary: The Holy Spirit isn't just a theological concept - He's your constant companion and helper. You can learn to recognize His voice and rely on His power in your daily life. This week you can explore how the Spirit wants to guide and empower you.
keyIdeas: The Holy Spirit is God living in you, not just with you
You can learn to recognize the Spirit's voice through practice
The Spirit produces fruit in your life as you cooperate with Him
Every believer has spiritual gifts to use for God's kingdom
reflectionQs: How do you currently experience the Holy Spirit in your life?
What spiritual gifts do you think God has given you?
How can you be more sensitive to the Spirit's guidance today?

practice.title: Spirit Awareness
practice.desc: Pause three times today and ask 'What is the Holy Spirit saying to me right now?'

practice.title: Gift Discovery
practice.desc: Ask two people who know you well what they see as your spiritual gifts.

weeks.prayer: Holy Spirit, thank You for living in me. Help me to be more aware of Your presence and more responsive to Your guidance in my daily life.

weeks.title: Community and Fellowship
weeks.theme: Connecting with the Body of Christ, the importance of church, and loving one another.
weeks.lessonSummary: You weren't meant to follow Jesus alone. God designed you to grow in community with other believers. This week you can explore what it means to be part of the church and how to build meaningful Christian friendships.
keyIdeas: The church is God's family, not just a building or event
You need other believers to help you grow and stay accountable
Community requires vulnerability and commitment
You can be a source of encouragement and support for others
reflectionQs: What does Christian community look like in your life right now?
How can you be more intentional about connecting with other believers?
What would help you feel more comfortable being vulnerable in Christian community?

practice.title: Community Connection
practice.desc: Reach out to one Christian friend this week for encouragement or support.

practice.title: Serve Together
practice.desc: Find one way to serve alongside other believers in your community.

weeks.prayer: God, thank You for placing me in Your family. Help me to be a good brother/sister to other believers and to receive the support and encouragement You provide through them.

weeks.title: Obedience and Character
weeks.theme: Pursuing Christlike character, holiness, and obeying Jesus in everyday life.
weeks.lessonSummary: Following Jesus means more than just believing - it means becoming like Him. You can grow in Christlike character through daily choices and habits. This week you can explore what it means to pursue holiness and integrity in your everyday life.
keyIdeas: Holiness is about becoming like Jesus, not following rules
Character is built through small, consistent choices
You can't be holy on your own - you need God's help
Integrity means being the same person everywhere
reflectionQs: What areas of your character need the most growth right now?
How can you pursue holiness without becoming legalistic?
Where do you struggle most with integrity?

practice.title: Character Check
practice.desc: At the end of each day, ask 'How did I reflect Jesus in my choices today?'

practice.title: Integrity Moment
practice.desc: Choose one situation this week where you'll prioritize integrity over convenience.

weeks.prayer: Lord, make me more like You. Help me to choose holiness in the small moments and to grow in character that honors You.

weeks.title: Serving Others
weeks.theme: Using your spiritual gifts and time to serve God and people with humility and love.
weeks.lessonSummary: Jesus came to serve, and He calls you to do the same. You can discover how God wants to use your unique gifts and passions to bless others. This week you can explore what it means to serve with the right heart and find your place in God's kingdom work.
keyIdeas: Serving others is how you serve God
Everyone has something valuable to contribute
Service should flow from love, not obligation
Small acts of service can have big impact
reflectionQs: What are your natural gifts and how could they serve others?
What causes or needs stir your heart?
How can you serve others without burning out?

practice.title: Daily Service
practice.desc: Look for one opportunity each day to serve someone in a small way.

practice.title: Gift Assessment
practice.desc: Take time to reflect on your gifts and how you might use them to serve.

weeks.prayer: God, show me how You want to use my life to serve others. Give me a heart of humility and love as I look for ways to bless those around me.

weeks.title: Sharing Your Faith
weeks.theme: Learning to share the gospel and your testimony, and living on mission in the world.
weeks.lessonSummary: Sharing your faith isn't about being pushy or having all the answers - it's about sharing the hope you've found in Jesus. You can learn to share your story naturally and compassionately. This week you can explore how to live on mission in your everyday world.
keyIdeas: Your story is powerful - you don't need to be a theologian
Sharing faith starts with building relationships
You can be prepared without being pushy
Living like Jesus is the best way to share Jesus
reflectionQs: What's your story of how you came to know Jesus?
Who in your life might benefit from hearing about your faith?
How can you build relationships with people who don't know Jesus?

practice.title: Story Practice
practice.desc: Write out your testimony in 2-3 minutes; practice sharing it with a friend.

practice.title: Relationship Building
practice.desc: Initiate one conversation this week with someone who doesn't share your faith.

weeks.prayer: Lord, give me courage and wisdom to share Your love with others. Help me to live in such a way that people want to know what makes me different.

weeks.title: Spiritual Warfare and Freedom
weeks.theme: Understanding the battle against sin and evil, and how to stand firm in Christ's victory.
weeks.lessonSummary: There's a spiritual battle happening, but you don't have to be afraid - Jesus has already won. You can learn to recognize the enemy's tactics and stand firm in your identity in Christ. This week you can explore how to live in freedom and victory.
keyIdeas: The battle is real, but the victory is already won
Your identity in Christ is your greatest weapon
You can recognize lies and replace them with truth
Prayer and Scripture are powerful weapons against spiritual attack
reflectionQs: What lies about yourself do you often believe?
How do you typically respond when you face spiritual opposition?
What truths from Scripture can help you stand firm?

practice.title: Truth Declaration
practice.desc: Each morning, declare one truth from Scripture about your identity in Christ.

practice.title: Lie Recognition
practice.desc: When you notice negative thoughts, ask 'Is this from God or the enemy?'

weeks.prayer: Jesus, thank You that You have overcome the world. Help me to stand firm in Your victory and to recognize and reject the enemy's lies.

weeks.title: Perseverance in Trials
weeks.theme: Trusting God through challenges and cultivating faith, hope, and joy in difficult times.
weeks.lessonSummary: Life will have hard seasons, but God can use them to make you stronger and more like Jesus. You can learn to face trials with faith and hope. This week you can explore how to persevere and even find joy in difficult circumstances.
keyIdeas: Trials are not a sign that God has abandoned you
God can use difficult times to strengthen your faith
You can choose joy even in the midst of pain
Perseverance builds character and hope
reflectionQs: How do you typically respond when life gets difficult?
What trials have helped you grow closer to God?
How can you support others who are going through hard times?

practice.title: Gratitude in Trials
practice.desc: Each day, find one thing to be grateful for, even in difficult circumstances.

practice.title: Support Others
practice.desc: Reach out to someone who is going through a difficult time.

weeks.prayer: Father, help me to trust You even when life is hard. Give me the strength to persevere and the faith to see Your goodness in every season.

weeks.title: Living on Mission
weeks.theme: Continuing as a disciple: making disciples of others and embracing the Great Commission.
weeks.lessonSummary: This isn't the end of your journey - it's just the beginning. You're now equipped to help others discover the same life-changing relationship with Jesus. This week you can explore how to live as a disciple-maker and continue growing in your faith.
keyIdeas: Making disciples is every believer's calling
You don't need to be perfect to help others grow
Discipleship happens best in relationships
Your mission field is wherever God has placed you
reflectionQs: Who in your life could benefit from what you've learned in this course?
How do you want to continue growing in your faith after these 12 weeks?
What would it look like for you to make disciples in your context?

practice.title: Share Your Journey
practice.desc: Tell someone about what you've learned and how it's changed you.

practice.title: Next Steps Planning
practice.desc: Create a plan for how you'll continue growing as a disciple.

weeks.prayer: Lord, thank You for this journey of growth. Help me to continue following You and to share the hope I've found with others. Use my life to make disciples for Your kingdom.
